page.title: 19FLORA & FAUNA OF HEADCORN
page.content: {Foxes}abound along with{weasels}and {stoats,}supported by a good number of {voles,brown rats,mice and moles}in the rough grassland.{Hares,grey squirrels {hedgehogs are}to be found,with{wild {mink}near water.{Rabbit}numbers are increasing. There are some good colonies of{pipistrelle bat}and some as yet unidentified species. Reptiles include{grass snakes,slow worms,newts and,rarely,{toads.}There are also {lizards}and{adders.}Many species of coarse fish inhabit river and pond:- {pike,perch,tench,bream,roach,chub,eels {gudgeon,minnow,millers thumb.}Wood and meadow,arable land,water and garden have a thriving{bird}poulation. Many {plants}bring grace and colour to our area:-{wild rose,milkmaid,cow parsley, {herb Robert,stitchwort,crane's bill, {red campion,rose-bay willow-herb. This is a truly beautiful area to see.
